Serialized Form

  • Package <Unnamed>

    • Class Init extends javax.swing.JPanel implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      1L

    • Class MainGUI extends Init implements Serializable

      serialVersionUID:
      1L

      • Serialized Fields

        • XCoord

          java.lang.String[] XCoord
          These arrays are the grid that compose the board. The XCoord Array holds the letters A-H that span the possible movement spaces from left to right of the game window.

        • inPath

          java.lang.Boolean inPath

        • YCoord

          java.lang.Integer[] YCoord
          The YCoord Array holds the numbers 1-8 that span the possible movement spaces from top to bottom of the game window

        • coordinates

          java.lang.String[][] coordinates
          Contains Coordinates for every tile and is used to set it up in a grid layout to resemble a checkers game board

        • coordinates2

          java.lang.String[][] coordinates2

        • Coord

          java.lang.String Coord

        • futureCoord

          java.lang.String futureCoord

        • tiles

          javax.swing.JButton[][] tiles
          Places a click-able JButton on every one of the movement spaces on the game board

        • prevCommand

          java.lang.String prevCommand

        • jp1

          javax.swing.JPanel jp1
          Creates a JPanel which is the interface that will be used to interact with the user. JPanel allows the user to give a specific set of commands using the ActionListener class on each button that is placed on the JPanel.

        • jp2

          javax.swing.JPanel jp2
          Another JPanel, refer to jp1 explanation.

        • jp3

          javax.swing.JPanel jp3
          Another JPanel, refer to jp1 explanation.

        • counter2

          int counter2
          Used as a counter to check how many times a user has clicked on the board.

        • gameStart

          boolean gameStart
          Checks if the game has started. Initial value is false.

        • Checkers

          Checker[] Checkers
          private array that will contain all the checker pieces that are currently on the board

        • maxBlack

          int maxBlack
          private constant for maximum amount of black checker pieces allowed on the board

        • maxGrey

          int maxGrey
          private constant for maximum amount of grey checker pieces allowed on the board

        • counter3

          int counter3
          Used as a counter to check how many times a user has clicked on the board.

          int maxKingBlack
          Holds Maximum number of King Black Pieces

          boolean isYellow
          Checks if Yellow piece has been selected

        • maxKingGrey

          int maxKingGrey
          Holds Maximum number of King White Pieces

        • total

          int total
          private constant for the total amount of pieces that are allowed on the board

        • counter

          int counter
          private counter value for game pieces on the board starting at 0

          Checks if the game is in setup mode
